data.text:
April 5, 2017

I read this online at http://www.heroicfantasyquarterly.com... and then listened to an audio dramatization at http://dreamtowermedia.com/podcast/, you can get it there or listen to it on https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ir64N.... If you like Fafhrd and the Gray Mouser which this story very much reminded of or other S&S with a dash of Aladdin (the story not the movies), give this a try I think you'll enjoy it.

September 8, 2021

This was the perfect read for a short flight. Nods towards Fafhrd and Gray Mouser are obvious, but intended. The author adds a bit of Middle-eastern spice to the mix and flavors the tale well with eloquent descriptions and good, fast pacing.

I discovered this through Robert Zoltan’s podcast, Literary Wonder & Adventure. I am an infrequent listener of podcasts, but LW&A never disappoints. Based upon the strength of it, I decided to give this free read a go (I think I got it free through the podcast?).

I’m glad I did! It lay in the electronic depths of my Kindle too long. I should have conjured it up sooner and will now seek out more adventures of Dareon and Blue.

Recommended to fans of Sword & Sorcery.
